content.text:
# Draft:Warfare in Malay Peninsula and Borneo

Interstate warfare was practiced in the Malay Peninsula and Borneo during and prior to European colonisation.
Background
In the pre-colonial era, the Malays had their own forces, divided between the islands, each one with its own ruler. Which usually contained Pendekar (warrior or knight), Mujahideen (conscripted peasants) and Mercenaries.
Tactics and strategies
The tactics and strategies prevalent during the Malay Peninsula and Borneo islands.
